page.title: 07A DAY IN A FARMERS LIFE
page.content: The farmer gets up at about six-thirty in the morning and the first thing he does is get meal for the cows. The next thing he does is set up the milkers and then he goes to fetch the cows and starts milking. While the cows are being milked he feeds the calves. When all the milking is finished he washes the utensils and cools the milk. After this he would go for his breakfast at about eight- thirty. At nine o' clock, the milk tanker arrives to collect the milk to be taken to the creameries. The farmer then has to sterilise the milk tank and wash out the byre and clean up. For the remainder of the day, he will work in the fields perhaps cutting hay or silage.
